results.title: How to manage the boss
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
The subordinate must be able to “read” the boss, to be able to communicate, to prevent “surprises” - problems and crises that could have been anticipated. Bosses need support from the staff, which if given will augment personal effectiveness. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to make the organization work for you
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Rules, procedures and good manners are essential, but flexibility is needed. No organisation can operate solely “by the book”. Accomplishment should be the aim, not solely promotion. Outside interests should be developed as a buffer against possible disappointments in the later stages of one’s career. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to make the famous pisco sour
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
‘Pisco Sour’ represents a shift beyond earlier works in its dense layering of subject-matter and imagery. Initiated in Australia and completed in Japan, the work draws upon the core imagery of a bullock dray, a male figure in silhouette, a Japanese mask and a bottle of Pisco Sour. These appear in varied permutations alongside other seemingly random images to form a series of telescopic views (screens within screens). Verbal narrative and textual statement create a sense of tension whilst suggesting that history and meaning are never fixed. The work presents something of a conundrum, its title a metaphoric recipe for the potential ‘souring’ of things.

Produced with the assistance of the Visual Arts Board of the Australia Council.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: How to make a truck
results.brief_description: Looks at the relatively small scale manufacture of trucks for specialized applications in the United States. Provides a simple but comprehensive explanation of the assembly line and the entire process of truck production.

results.title: How to make a movie without a camera
results.creator_credit: Rainy Day Productions, Michael Warshaw and Mimi Warshaw
results.brief_description: Presents the results of efforts made to produce a film without a camera, using the following techniques to produce striking effects: vegetable dye colouring, felt-tipped pen, sprays and fingerprints all individually applied to clear leader; and scratching and perforating of opaque leader. The film is especially useful to young filmmakers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Rainy Day Productions, Michael Warshaw and Mimi Warshaw

results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’
